thread.title: Hayden Roulston misses out on New Zealand track cycling squad for Cali
thread.title_full: Hayden Roulston misses out on New Zealand track cycling squad for Cali

title: Hayden Roulston misses out on New Zealand track cycling squad for Cali
text:
Hayden Roulston misses out on New Zealand track cycling squad for Cali Last updated 10:01, October 16 2015 DIANNE MANSON/GETTY IMAGES 
Eddie Dawkins will compete with the New Zealand team sprint in Cali. 
Hayden Roulston will miss the first UCI Track World Cup of the year, but a strong New Zealand squad has been named in his absence. 
The 34-year-old has made the switch back to track cycling with the Rio Olympics in mind, but must complete his final road obligations with Trek Factory Racing, forcing his absence from the team. 
This sees Shane Archbold, a member of the Bora Argon 18 UCI Pro Continental squad in Europe, called into the New Zealand men's team pursuit and given a chance to raise his hand for Rio. 
The 2014 world champion team sprinters will headline the squad in Cali, Colombia, with Ethan Mitchell, Sam Webster and Eddie Dawkins making the team fresh from a win over Australia at the Oceania Championships in Invercargill. 
Fellow sprinter Simon van Velthooven will also make the trip, competing in the keirin competition under the High Performance Sport NZ banner. 
London Olympian Natasha Hansen is paired with Katie Schofield for the women's sprint, after coming back into the international scene at Cali in January. 
The pair finished second to Olympic champions Anna Meares and Kaarle McCulloch at the Oceania Championships where Hansen finished second in the 500m time trial and third in the sprint behind the Australians. 
The endurance teams for Cali are mostly from the squads that competed with success at Invercargill last week, bar Roulston.
